title: The election where the president wants the opposition to win
description: President Uhuru Kenyatta wants long-time rival Raila Odinga to win next month's presidential poll.

title: BBC debate: Liz Truss and Rishi Sunak fact-checked
description: Reality Check investigates some of the claims made in the BBC Tory leadership candidates' debate.

title: Utah's Great Salt Lake is running out of water
description: This July, the largest salt water lake in the Western Hemisphere reached its lowest level ever recorded.

title: Did the debate change these voters' minds?
description: After the BBC's debate between the two candidates to become Tory leader - and PM - what did the audience make of it?

title: AJ Dillon: Green Bay Police reviewing incident where officer shoves running back
description: The Green Bay Police Department will review an incident in which one of its officers shoved Green Bay Packers running back AJ Dillon.

title: Tory leadership debate: Five key moments from Truss-Sunak clash
description: The main talking points as the final two candidates hoping to be PM go head-to-head in a TV debate.

title: Tory leadership debate: Highlights from Our Next Prime Minister
description: Missed the debate or need a recap? Watch the two candidates to replace Boris Johnson go head-to head.

title: Sergio Garcia to 'hold off' on quitting DP World Tour in hope of playing Ryder Cup
description: Sergio Garcia says he is "going to hold off on" giving up his membership of the DP World Tour to see if he could still play in the Ryder Cup.

title: We hope to make fans proud again, says England boss
description: England manager Sarina Wiegman says the "mentality has been really good" from her players as they prepare for a fourth successive major tournament semi-final on Tuesday.

title: Euro 2022: England face Sweden in semi-final at Bramall Lane
description: England will attempt to reach the European Women's Championship final for a third time when they face 1984 winners Sweden on Tuesday.

title: Commonwealth Games 2022: Complex emotions as past meets present
description: The word Commonwealth prompts conflicted feelings among some of Birmingham's residents.

title: Commonwealth Games: Birmingham 2022 medals table
description: Which country is leading the medal table? Medals table for the 2022 Commonwealth Games in Birmingham.

title: Alessia Russo: The England super sub who could force her way into the starting line-up
description: Striker Alessia Russo used to be made to play in goal by her brothers but with her vital goals from the bench she has emerged as one of England's Euro 2022 stars.

title: Rishi Sunak and Liz Truss: Your guide to the BBC Tory leadership debate
description: Here's what you need to know about Monday's head-to-head debate between Rishi Sunak and Liz Truss.

title: Archie Battersbee: Parents lose appeal over life support
description: The 12-year-old has been in hospital since being found unconscious at home in April.

title: Cricket Scotland inquiry hears 448 examples of racism
description: The review concludes that the governance and leadership of the sport was institutionally racist.

title: Eurovision: UK to host next year's Song Contest
description: Ukraine welcomes decision for contest in UK after organisers said winning country could not be host.

title: Police probe death threats to Penny Mordaunt
description: Portsmouth North MP Penny Mordaunt was sent a letter threatening to "kill her family", reports say.

title: Eurotunnel and Dover queues: Drivers warned of summer of Channel traffic delays
description: This weekend is expected to be "very busy" as holidaymakers look to get away to the continent.

title: In pictures: First Scottish Tree Hugging Championships
description: Events at the inaugural championships included hugging as many trees in one minute.

title: Train strikes: People told not to travel by rail during walkouts
description: Only 20% of services will run and some places will have no trains on Wednesday, Network Rail says.

title: Myanmar's executed activists: Phyo Zeya Thaw and Ko Jimmy
description: Weeks before Myanmar executed four democracy activists, the BBC spoke to their family and friends.

title: Likely cause of mystery child hepatitis outbreak found
description: UK experts believe they can now explain the recent spate of mysterious liver problems in young children.

title: Free refreshments offer for fan hit by ball during match
description: The dramatic image of the man spilling his drink and food is proving popular on social media.

title: Ukraine war: Russian investigator says 92 Ukrainians charged
description: A top Moscow investigator says 92 armed forces members are charged with crimes against humanity.

title: Three policy questions Liz Truss and Rishi Sunak must answer
description: The final two candidates for prime minister have some fundamental decisions to make over the economy.

title: High stakes for Sunak and Truss before first debate
description: The broadcast battle is vital for both candidates, says the BBC's political editor Chris Mason.

title: Elon Musk denies affair with Google co-founder Sergey Brin's wife
description: The technology multi-billionaire's comments came in response to a report in the Wall Street Journal.

title: NHS in England faces worst ever staffing crisis, MPs warn
description: The large number of unfilled NHS job vacancies is posing a serious risk to patient safety, MPs say.

title: Ryanair boss hits out at airports: 'They had one job'
description: Neil Sorahan says airports have not recruited enough staff to cater for the rebound in travellers.

title: What to expect from Euro 2022 semi-finals: England v Sweden, Germany v France
description: Here is what to look out for in the two Euro 2022 semi-finals as hosts England play Sweden and Germany face France.

title: Myanmar: Military executes four democracy activists including ex-MP
description: The executions mark the first cases of capital punishment in the country in decades.

title: Comic-Con: Neil Gaiman's epic comic Sandman finally reaches the screen
description: The story which follows a quest by Dream is one the most popular graphic novels of all time

title: Kevin Proctor sacked by Gold Coast Titans after vaping in toilet cubicle during defeat
description: New Zealand international Kevin Proctor is sacked by NRL side Gold Coast Titans after vaping in a toilet cubicle during their defeat by Canterbury.

title: Tory leadership: Stoke-on-Trent hosts Rishi Sunak and Liz Truss debate
description: Rishi Sunak and Liz Truss will face off in Stoke-on-Trent, a city where many do not know the MPs.

title: World Athletics Championships: GB win bronze in women's 4x400m relay final
description: Watch as the Great Britain team of Victoria Ohuruogu, Nicole Yeargin, Jess Knight and Laviai Nielsen win the bronze medal in the women's 4x400m relay final at the World Athletics Championships in Oregon, USA.

title: World Athletics Championships: Keely Hodgkinson takes silver in 800m duel with Athing Mu
description: Great Britain's Keely Hodgkinson falls just short of the world title in a thrilling home-straight duel with Olympic champion Athing Mu.

title: World Athletics Championships: GB's Keely Hodgkinson narrowly misses out on gold in dramatic 800m
description: Watch as Great Britain's Keely Hodgkinson wins silver after finishing just 0.08 seconds behind the USA's Athing Mu with a time of one minute 56.38 seconds.

title: World Athletics Championships: Tobi Amusan smashes women's 100m hurdles world record and then wins gold
description: Nigeria's Tobi Amusan beats the 100m hurdles world record and then wins gold in the final.

title: Comic-Con: Five things we learned
description: Fans have been given an exclusive glimpse of footage from a host of new blockbusters.
